Description: Book of the Dead of Anhay; frame 2; full colour vignettes; blue border at top, yellow/red at bottom. Horus leads Anhay to judgement; texts spoken by Horus and Thoth. Vignettes of the Portals of Osiris with spell 146.
Curator's comments: Published: R. Freed, A Divine Tour of Ancient Egypt, Memphis 1983, pp.91, 95 [73].
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (14)
Taylor 2010 / Journey through the afterlife: Ancient Egyptian Book of the Dead (no.26)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (134517) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/134517)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1983 Sep-Dec, Memphis, Art Gallery of Memphis, A Divine Tour of Ancient Egypt 1998/9 Oct-Jun, South Carolina, The Charleston Museum, Queens & Commoners of the New Kingdom 2010 4th Nov-2011 6th March, Round Reading Room BM, Book of the Dead
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: bleached, fractured, loss Black ink Red ink Pigment: faded, friable, loss Backed: brown paper Checked for loan to USA 1997 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: Filmoplast T self adhesive linen tape Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: C Curatorial condition comment: good
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
